This app demonstrates:

1. All possible sidebar parameters:
   - `id`: For tracking sidebar state
   - `position`: Left/right positioning
   - `open`: Control initial state for desktop/mobile
   - `width`: Sidebar width
   - `title`: Sidebar title
   - `bg`: Background color
   - `fg`: Text color
   - `class_`: Additional CSS classes
   - `max_height_mobile`: Maximum height on mobile devices
   - `gap`: Spacing between elements
   - `padding`: Internal padding

2. The app is minimal and includes only necessary components to demonstrate the sidebar functionality.

3. No external files or data are used.

4. Uses express mode syntax throughout.

To run this app:
1. Save it as `app.py`
2. Run with `shiny run app.py`

The sidebar will be collapsible by default and will display its current state (open/closed) in the main content area.

The app avoids unnecessary complexity while still showcasing all sidebar parameters and their usage. The main content area is intentionally minimal to keep focus on the sidebar functionality.
